data.title: Trains to West Ham
data.meta_description: Find information on West Ham including live departure boards, station information and cheap train tickets with Trainline.
data.text:
West Ham Railway Station serves West Ham in east London with London Underground, Docklands Light Railway, and National Rail mainline trains to a variety of destinations. Lying across Zones 2 and 3, service from the station sees Underground trains from West Ham run twelve times hourly each direction on the District Line, six an hour each direction on the Hammersmith & City Line, sixteen trains an hour each way on the Jubilee Line, six trains an hour to Stratford International and Woolwich Arsenal on the DLR network, and eight c2c trains to Fenchurch Street, four to Shoeburyness, two to Grays, and two to Southend Central. London Bus route 276 serves the station.

A heavily-travelled station due to its location across multiple Underground and mainline tracks, West Ham has eight platforms (four sets of island platforms), all of which are in frequent use. The station has good facilities, including public wifi, self-service ticketing provisions with Oyster top-up, cashpoints, and customer help points. There is step-free access to all platforms; however, there may be a step of up between the train and the platform on London Underground services.

Find address details, station facilities, live departure times and train arrivals for West Ham station.
